fields.description: Hi, this request is about the functional behavior of color codes in Team Calendar. A user has created a calendar and she has specified a color for each event type. When adding the calendar to their own calendars list, other users can change the color of a specific event type. The request is to make it possible to force the color to be consistent across all users.
fields.summary: Other users can change someone's color code for a given calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48703].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Monthly repeated event team calendar showing one hour difference between October and November for start time.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a new team calendar with Europe/Moscow Timezone
 * Change Profile Timezone to moscow. Profile > Settings 
 * Create an event and set it to below configuration

 
{quote}Event Type : Event
 What : Test
 All day event : (untick)
 When : 10-Nov-2016 08:00 to 10-Nov-2016 09:00 
 Repeat: Monthly
 Repeat Every : 1 Month
{quote} * Click ok

 
h3. Expected Results

User should be seeing the same start time set in october in november which is "08:00"
h3. Actual Results

User seeing the start time set on November is "09:00"
fields.summary: 1 hour difference between October and November in Team Calendar
Confluence email "... updated a event" should be "... an event"

fields.description:
Repro steps:
# Add a JIRA Issue dates event.
# Select a field in the _Single date_ list
# Edit one of the JIRA issue dates event.
# In the date picker, enter a date after the original date. Do not use the date picker calendar, just type the date.
# Click OK to save the changes.

You receive an error saying: _The start date must not be after the end date_; but you are not able to edit the end date, as it is a single date event and the end date field is grayed out.
fields.summary: Cannot enter future date in JIRA event with single date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48699].
  {panel}

Unable to change the colors on a team calendar when creating custom event types, when a user tries to change the color they get the following error:

 Error(s) occurred.

    Unable to change the color of the calendar. Please authenticate first.

This also occurs for non custom event types.

h6. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.8.4
# Install Team Calendars 5.2.13
# Create a calendar without a related space.
# Add a 'Travel' event and change colors. 
# Verify color change.
# Upgrade to Team Calendars 5.3.9
# Attempt to change color of 'Travel' event and get error.

h6. Workaround
* Add a related space to the calendar
fields.summary: Unable to change the colors on a team calendar with custom event types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After a calendar is renamed to a new name, the calendar is still searchable only with the old name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as UserA
# Create a new Calendar in Team Calendars and name it "Donkey"
# Logout, and login as User B
# Add an existing calendar into User B's calendar, and look for "Donkey" (calendar is easily searchable, and added to User B's list of calendars)
# User B would then edit the calendar name, and change it from "Donkey", to "Foo Test"
# Create a new page using either User B or User A, and add the Team Calendars macro. Add an existing calendar, and  search for the "Foo Test" calendar

h3. Expected Results
"Foo Test" should be returned as a search result. 

h3. Actual Results
No results returned for "Foo Test", but searching for "Donkey" returns the "Foo Test" calendar

h3. Workaround

Go to _Confluence administration > Team Calendars > Rebuild Search Index_ and rebuild search index
fields.summary: New Calendar Name Not Searchable After Calendar Name Rename

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48681].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When adding an existing calendar, search results (if providing more than 4 calendars that match the search query, thus causing a scrollbar to appear), scroll infinitely.

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.161.0
Team Calendar 5.3.11-D20160504T003457

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create at least 4 calendars in Team Calendar that share a similar keyword.
# Now attempt to Add New Calendar > Add Existing Calendar (you can follow the video)
# Click to search, and type the keyword you used, and you'll see the results keep scrolling
 [^Recording #12.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Only 1 of each result should appear

h3. Actual Results
Results go on forever
Additionally, if there are fewer than 4 calendars w/ the shared keyword, they duplicate.

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Add existing calendar search results produce duplicated or infinite results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48680].
  {panel}

This has already been documented by another user at: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-2729

However, that issue - and issues linked to it - were marked closed as duplicates (even though none of them were actually resolved).

Team Calendars version 5.1.7 upgrade resulted in our custom date (only) fields being displayed as date/time fields.  The default times were 6:00pm to 6:00pm for a full day event (all of ours are full day events because they originate in date only custom fields.)  This addition of a time was shifting the display of date ranges by a day.

I downgraded to 5.0.5 and the problem went away - but eventually we will want to upgrade.
fields.summary: Custom date field showing as date/time on Team Calendars and shifting the date range bar by a day

fields.description:
When accessing the preview of a calendar {{%baseurl%/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=%calendarid%}} something that wants to be a feature tour shoes up but Somethings seem to be missing. AFAICS this behavior  is new since from 5.3.10 to 5.3.11

*Steps to replicate:*

# Install confluence 5.8.18
# Install Team calendar 5.2.18
# Create a Calendar by subscribing to any calendar (exp:  https://calendar.google.com/calendar/ical/en.danish%23holiday%40group.v.calendar.google.com/public/basic.ics) 
# *Leave the related space empty*
# Click on the calendar, embed/share you will noticed the url as below: {{http://localhost:5818/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=acb71ec9-2e1d-4e80-a106-6304e46d5e66}} which working fine if you opening it at a new tab
!003.JPG|thumbnail!
# Upgrade to latest Team Calendar
# Click on the embed url again, and open in a new tab:
# Noticed that the preview broken and load forever
!002.JPG|thumbnail!


*Workaround*
# Edit the calendar
# Fill in the related Space
# Check on the embed again, noticed the URL has been changed as below, which is working fine on a new tab:
{{http://localhost:5818/display/WAYN/calendar/acb71ec9-2e1d-4e80-a106-6304e46d5e66?calendarName=sub}}
!004.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Team calendar preview load forever

fields.description:
Use am-pm time format to enter time in events on Team Calendar
h3. Summary

In team calendars in Confluence, we are not able to enter the time in am-pm time, it's possible to change the format the time is displayed on the Team Calendar admin settings (Cog Menu>General Settings>Team calendar on the left hand menu), although it only changes the time when the event is already saved, also tried to change the confluence time format on the general settings although this change did not take effect on team calendar.
h3. Environment

Cloud environment / JIRA Cloud Version: 7.2.0-OD-03-010

 

Server environment / Confluence 6.0.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create an event on team calendar and try to set it with am pm time format.
h3. Expected Results

Be able to create events with am pm time when changing the configuration in Team Calendar settings
h3. Actual Results

The am pm time is only displayed after the event is saved.
h3. Notes

No Notes
h3. Workaround

The user need to use 24 hours format to create events on team calendar
fields.summary: Use am-pm time format to enter time in events on Team Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Notifications are not sent when an instance of a recurrent event are edited for the first time. On a second edit, the notification is sent normally.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Two users and one calendar in testing:

Test Calendar - Calendar created for testing, accessible by both users.
 User A - Is a watcher of the Test Calendar
 User B - Making the events and editing them on the Test Calendar

Scenario:
 # User B adds a repeated event on Test Calendar with the "What" field;
 # User B selects an instance of the newly created event and modifies the "What" field by adding an arbitrary statement; 
 # User A does not receive a notification of the single event being updated.
 # User B edits that same single event again, changing the "What" field;
 # User A receives a notification that the event was updated on the second edition.

User A should have received two notifications, one for each edit. However, the first edit notification was never sent.
h3. Expected Results

Notification should be sent on both updates.
h3. Workaround

No workaround so far.
fields.summary: Notifications not being sent on first update of an instance of a recurrent event

fields.description:
If you specify a range from one Date Field to another Date Field, Team Calendar will display the range incorrectly.

h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field type called "PlannedStart"
# Create a new issue that uses this custom field, and:
## Set the "Due Date" to "15/01/2015" (15th Jan 2015)
## Set the "PlannedStart" to "13/01/2015" (13th Jan 2015)
# Display a date range for this issue in Team Calendar

h5.Expected Results
Team Calendar should display a range from the 13th to the 15th

h5.Actual Results
Team Calendar starts the event at a certain time on the 13th (in my case it was 11:00AM), and the date range is subsequently longer:

!DateRangeInCalendar.png|thumbnail!

h5.Workaround
Use a Date/Time picker for the fields to be shown in Team Calendar. When a Date/Time picker is used, Team Calendar will display the correct range: 

!CorrectDateRange.png|thumbnail!

This appears related to TEAMCAL-2718, but I'm raising it as a separate issue in case this is not the same cause.

This search should return any items:

resolvedBy != "" and status was not in (resolved)

As an item that has never been resolved should not have a resolver. However, linked issues such as "relates to" and "clones" that have been resolved are populating this attribute.

This was noticed when the search: resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints()

resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints() and assignee was in (user1, user2, user3)

But this is also inaccurate as a true resolver does not necessarily posses the item when resolving.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Team Calendar is not recording event time correctly for Hong Kong Timezone

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.11.2
Team Calendar 6.0.27


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Team Calendar
# Add 2 new Calendars with the *Time zone* set as below respectively:
#* Asia/Kuala Lumpur (+0800)
#* Asia/Hong Kong (+0800)
# Add one new Event into each of the calendars with the same date and time
#* For example: 28th March 2019, 8:00 AM
# Export both of the Calendars into [iCalendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/export-team-calendars-content-to-other-calendars-240913738.html] and this will trigger the browser to download an {{.ics}} file
# View the exported {{.ics}} files in a text editor and look for the events created

h3. Expected Results
The Events in both calendars are recorded as the *same time* since both of the calendar's Timezone is in GMT+8 and both places do not observe Daylight Saving

h3. Actual Results
The event that is found in Hong Kong timezone's calendar export is off by one hour earlier.
{code:title=Hong Kong Timezone Calendar Export (x)}
BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTAMP:20190328T005433Z
DTSTART;TZID=Asia/Hong_Kong:20190328T090000
DTEND;TZID=Asia/Hong_Kong:20190328T100000
SUMMARY:HK Time
CATEGORIES:other
{code}
{code:title=Kuala Lumpur Timezone Calendar Export (/)}
BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTAMP:20190328T005424Z
DTSTART;TZID=Asia/Kuala_Lumpur:20190328T080000
DTEND;TZID=Asia/Kuala_Lumpur:20190328T090000
SUMMARY:KL Time
CATEGORIES:other
{code}


h3. Information
Although both of the events will still be displaying correctly within Confluence/Team Calendar itself:
 !Event show in Team Calendar.png|thumbnail! 
But if the calendar is being [subscribed from an external source|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-google-calendar-273285887.html] such as Google Calendar, the event time will not be displayed correctly because it is off by an hour.


h3. Workaround
# Avoid using Hong Kong Timezone if you need to subscribe the calendar from an external source
fields.summary: Team Calendar is not recording event time correctly for Hong Kong Timezone

fields.description:
The confluence calendar plugin seems unable to display events from a Jira iCal feed.

h2. To Reproduce

* Create a new calendar in confluence by clicking "add new calendar" on an instance of the calendar macro.
* Select "Subscription" in the location field
* Find a project calendar in jira and click on the "export in iCal Format" link
* insert this link into the url field in the new confluence calendar
* apply username/password as necessary to access the feed from confluence

h2. Result

The calendar seems to subscribe normally to the jira iCal feed but none of the events appear on the calendar.
This result also occurs if instead of subscribing to the feed, you download it from jira and include it as an attachment and attempt to display it in the confluence calendar this way. 

This bug is quite frustrating as I wish to subscribe to a number of jira projects' calendars in order to get an overview of the status of a number of projects on the one calendar.
fields.summary: The Calendar plugin cannot consume iCal feeds from Jira

h3. Summary
Event information is not imported whenever you try to import an ICS file from Google Calendars that contains repeat events. If you open the ICS file in a text editor and there are multiple events with the same UID parameter, only 1 event will get imported. All others will be missing and no logs are captured (even in DEBUG) stating this error.

{code}BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART:20150918T150000Z
DTEND:20150918T163000Z
DTSTAMP:20150923T164702Z
UID:o8hvlu94i7urfls69lm323srlc@google.com
ATTENDEE;X-NUM-GUESTS=0:mailto:USER@avenoso.com
SUMMARY:Busy
END:VEVENT

BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART:20150906T150000Z
DTEND:20150906T163000Z
DTSTAMP:20150925T154702Z
UID:o8hvlu94i7urfls69lm323srlc@google.com
ATTENDEE;X-NUM-GUESTS=0:mailto:ken@avenoso.com
SUMMARY:Busy
END:VEVENT
{code}

In this example, only the event for 09-06-2015 will get imported and all other events with this UID will not.

h3. Environment
Confluence with Team Calendars version 5.2.18

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Team Calendars
# Click on Add Calendar --> Import Calendar
# Upload an iCal file that includes repeat events with the same UID parameter.

h3. Expected Results
All events get imported or a warning comes up stating why this cannot be completed.

h3. Actual Results
Events are missing in Team Calendars.

h3.Workaround
Editing the iCal file in a text editor and changing the UID parameter for those repeat events then saving will result in a successful import after trying again. Example above with unique UID (adding the word TWO before the UID)

{code}BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART:20150918T150000Z
DTEND:20150918T163000Z
DTSTAMP:20150923T164702Z
UID:o8hvlu94i7urfls69lm323srlc@google.com
ATTENDEE;X-NUM-GUESTS=0:mailto:USER@avenoso.com
SUMMARY:Busy
END:VEVENT

BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART:20150906T150000Z
DTEND:20150906T163000Z
DTSTAMP:20150925T154702Z
UID:TWOo8hvlu94i7urfls69lm323srlc@google.com
ATTENDEE;X-NUM-GUESTS=0:mailto:ken@avenoso.com
SUMMARY:Busy
END:VEVENT
{code}
fields.summary: Imports/subscriptions from Google Calendar with non-unique UID's missing in Team Calendars

*Correct:*

*Incorrect:*

Many thanks

h3. Summary
When repeating an event in Team Calendars (Confluence) and selecting an End Repeat Date, the event fails to save. 

h3. Environment
{{Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015.40.1-0001}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create An Event
# Select Daily, Weekdays, Weekly, Monthly or Yearly for Repeat
# For End repeat, enter a date for On Date
# Click OK

h3. Expected Results
The event saves, creating a repeating an event on the calendar 

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the confluence log file:
{noformat}
2015-10-12 19:43:13.411063500 2015-10-12 19:43:13,406 WARN [ajp-bio-127.0.0.101-8009-exec-10] [extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date 2015-10-12T01:00:00.000+01:00/20151012T190213Z--679111344@testing124.atlassian.net time 08:00
2015-10-12 19:43:13.411065500  -- referer: /wiki/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | userName: sysadmin
2015-10-12 19:43:13.411066500 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid format: "2015-10-12T01:00:00.000+01:00/2015..." is malformed at "15-10-12T01:00:00.000+01:00/2015..."
{noformat}

On the user end, they receive a similar error:
{code}
Invalid date specified. It should look like 12-Oct-2015
{code}

h3.Workaround
No workaround

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48570].
  {panel}

Team Calendar events is not showing in Google Chrome when the timezone for Confluence is set to Moscow, St. Petersburg, Volgograd and the user's Windows PC timezone is set to Moscow, St. Petersburg, Volgograd as well.

Steps to reproduce
# Set Confluence timezone to Moscow, St. Petersburg, Volgograd
# Login with a Windows PC with Google Chrome. Set the timezone to Moscow, St. Petersburg, Volgograd like the screenshot below
!timeZoneTeamCalendarBug.jpg|thumbnail!
# Go to Team Calendar and you will see that all events are not shown 
!afterTimeZoneChange.jpg|thumbnail!
# Change timezone to other timezone in Windows. You will see that all events is now shown.
!beforeTimeZoneChange.jpg|thumbnail!

This is occurring on the latest version of Team Calendar (5.0.5)

*Workaround*
* Change the timezone of the Windows PC that is affected to a different timezone. However, please note that this might trigger other bugs on other applications.
* Alternatively, use a different browser other than Google Chrome. (eg. IE or Firefox)
fields.summary: events is not showing when timezone for Confluence is set to Moscow, St Petersburg, Volgograd
